trial_identification.studytitle: A Study of the Efficacy of ABT-199 in Subjects With Relapsed/Refractory or Previously Untreated Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia With the 17p Deletion
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Phase 2 Open-Label Study of the Efficacy of ABT-199 (GDC-0199) in Subjects With Relapsed/Refractory or Previously Untreated Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia Harboring the 17p Deletion

conditions.healthcondition: Cancer of the Blood and Bone Marrow

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - ABT-199
Experimental: Single arm - Single arm
Treatment: drugs: ABT-199 Tablet

primaryOutcome.outcome: Efficacy will be measured by overall response rate (ORR) (Main Cohort) - To evaluate the efficacy of ABT-199 monotherapy in subjects with relapsed or refractory chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) harboring the 17p deletion. (Main Cohort)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured up to 2 years after the last subject has enrolled on the study.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Number of subjects with adverse events (Expanded Safety Cohort) - Subjects will be monitored for clinical and laboratory evidence of adverse events throughout the study. (Expanded Safety Cohort)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured up to 5 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Change in physical exam findings, including vital signs (Expanded Safety Cohort) - Body temperature, weight, blood pressure, heart rate. (Expanded Safety Cohort)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured from Day -1 up to 2 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Change in clinical laboratory test results (Expanded Safety Cohort) - Chemistry, hematology, urinalysis, viral serologies. (Expanded Safety Cohort)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured from Day -1 up to 2 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Change in cardiac assessment findings (Expanded Safety Cohort) - Electrocardiogram and Multi Gated Acquisition Scan and/or Echocardiogram. (Expanded Safety Cohort)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured from Day -1 up to 2 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Percentage of subjects with adverse events (Expanded Safety Cohort) - Subjects will be monitored for clinical and laboratory evidence of adverse events throughout the study.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured up to 5 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Complete Remission (CR) rate - Complete remission rate per Independent Review Committee assessment, will be defined as the proportion of subjects who achieved a CR per the NCI-CWG (National Cancer Institute-Working Group) criteria.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured up to 2 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Partial Remission (PR) rate - Partial remission rate per Independent Review Committee assessment, will be defined as the proportion of subjects who achieved a PR per the NCI-CWG criteria.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured up to 2 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Duration of response - Duration of response will be defined as the number of days from the date of first response (Complete Remission or Partial Remission) per Independent Review Committee (IRC) assessment to the earliest recurrence or Progressive Disease per IRC assessment.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured up to 2 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Progression-free survival - Progression-free survival will be defined as the number of days from the date of first dose to the date of earliest disease progression (per Independent Review Committee assessment) or death.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured up to 5 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Time to progression - Time to progression will be defined as the number of days from the date of first dose to the date of earliest disease progression (per Independent Review Committee assessment).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured up to 5 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Overall survival - Overall survival will be defined as the number of days from the date of first dose to the date of death for all dosed subjects.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured up to 5 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Percent of subjects who move on to stem cell transplant - The percent of subjects who move on to stem cell transplant will be summarized and the 95% confidence interval based on the binomial distribution will be provided.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured up to 2 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Number of subjects with adverse events (Main Cohort) - Subjects will be monitored for clinical and laboratory evidence of adverse events throughout the study. (Main Cohort)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured up to 5 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Change in physical exam findings, including vital signs (Main Cohort) - Body temperature, weight, blood pressure, heart rate. (Main Cohort)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured from Day -1 up to 2 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Change in clinical laboratory test results (Main Cohort) - Chemistry, hematology, urinalysis, viral serologies. (Main Cohort)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured from Day -1 up to 2 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Change in cardiac assessment findings (Main Cohort) - Electrocardiogram and Multi Gated Acquisition Scan and/or Echocardiogram. (Main Cohort)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured from Day -1 up to 2 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Percentage of subjects with adverse events (Main Cohort) - Subjects will be monitored for clinical and laboratory evidence of adverse events throughout the study. (Main Cohort)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured up to 5 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Overall Response Rate (ORR) (Expanded Safety Cohort) - To evaluate the efficacy of ABT-199 monotherapy in subjects with relapsed or refractory chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) harboring the 17p deletion. (Expanded Safety Cohort)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured up to 2 years after the last subject has enrolled on the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Event free survival - Event-free survival is defined as the number of days from the date of first dose to the date of earliest disease progression, death, or start of a new anti-leukemic therapy.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured up to 5 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Time to first response - Time to first response will be defined as the number of days from the date of first dose to the date of the first sign of response (CR, CRi, nPR, or PR) given the subject has had a CR, CRi, confirmed nPR or confirmed PR per the 2008 Modified IWCLL NCI-WG criteria.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured up to 2 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Time to 50% reduction in absolute lymphocyte count - Time to 50% reduction in absolute lymphocyte count will be defined as the number of days (hours if applicable) from the date of first dose to the date when the absolute lymphocyte count has reduced to 50% of the baseline value.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured up to 2 years after the last subject has enrolled in the study.

eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Subject has undergone an allogeneic stem cell transplant.
- Subject has developed Richter's transformation confirmed by biopsy.
- Subject has prolymphocytic leukemia.
- Subject has active and uncontrolled autoimmune cytopenias (for 2 weeks prior to Screening), including autoimmune hemolytic anemia and idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura despite low dose corticosteroids.
- Subject has previously received ABT-199.
- Subject has received a biologic agent for anti-neoplastic intent within 30 days prior to the first dose of study drug.
- Subject has received any of the following within 14 days or 5 half-lives as applicable prior to the first dose of study drug, or has not recovered to less than Common Toxicity Criteria (CTC) grade 2 clinically significant adverse effect(s)/toxicity(s) of the previous therapy:
- Any anti-cancer therapy including chemotherapy, or radiotherapy;
- Investigational therapy, including targeted small molecule agents.
- Subject has known allergy to both xanthine oxidase inhibitors and rasburicase.

recruitment.hospital: Royal North Shore Hospital /ID# 98836 - St. Leonards

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This is a Phase 2, open label, multicenter, study evaluating the efficacy and safety of ABT-199 in relapsed or refractory subjects with CLL harboring 17p13 (TP53 locus) deletion. One hundred seven (107) subjects were enrolled in the main cohort, with evaluation of efficacy as the primary objective, and approximately 50 subjects will be enrolled in the safety expansion cohort to evaluate safety and updated tumor lysis syndrome prophylaxis and management measures. Enrollment into the main cohort is closed. Enrollment into the safety expansion cohort is closed.
